page.title: 17LUNAN CHURCH LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE CHURCH The parish church is situated by the bridge over the Lunan river. It is a very pleasant, small sandstone building in a neat kirk yard. It was built in 1844 on the site of a much earlier church probably the one mentioned in the 12th. century. Inside the church there is a memorial to Walter Mill who was pastor of the parish for forty years and the last martyr of the Reformation. He was burned at the stake at St.Andrews in 1558 in his 83rd. year for his adherence to the Protestant faith. Each year, on a Sunday evening in May or June near to the date of his martyrdom, a commemorative service is held in the church.
